title: Famous Telescopes
description: Test your knowledge of the great telescopes that have revealed the universe to us

questions.question: Which space telescope, launched in 1990, revolutionized our understanding of the universe?
The James Webb Space Telescope primarily observes in what part of the electromagnetic spectrum?
Who built one of the first astronomical telescopes and used it to discover Jupiter's moons?
The Arecibo Observatory, which collapsed in 2020, was located in which country?
What type of telescope did Isaac Newton invent that uses mirrors instead of lenses?
The Very Large Array (VLA) in New Mexico consists of how many radio antennas?
Which space telescope, launched in 2009, was specifically designed to find Earth-like exoplanets?
The Keck Observatory, one of the world's largest optical telescopes, is located on which Hawaiian mountain?
What was the main flaw discovered in the Hubble Space Telescope shortly after launch?
ALMA, one of the most powerful radio telescope arrays, is located in which country?
The FAST radio telescope, the world's largest single-dish radio telescope, is located in which country?
Which famous observatory, built in 1675, is located in Greenwich, England?
The Chandra X-ray Observatory is named after which Nobel Prize-winning astrophysicist?
At which Lagrange point does the James Webb Space Telescope orbit?
The Spitzer Space Telescope, retired in 2020, observed the universe primarily in what wavelength?
